content:
Diagnosis:	Hepatocellular carcinoma, BCLC stage B

Initial presentation March 2024 with 6.5cm segment VII mass and two satellite lesions (2.1cm, 1.8cm) in segment VI. Background Child-Pugh A cirrhosis. No extrahepatic disease.

Treatment:	First TACE procedure 15 April 2024

[redacted name] attended for review following his first TACE procedure to the right lobe lesions. He has experienced moderate post-embolization syndrome with right upper quadrant pain and low-grade fever which settled after 5 days. His appetite has now returned to normal and he reports feeling well. No new symptoms of concern.

Bloods show stable liver function with albumin 38, bilirubin 22, INR 1.1. AFP has decreased from 2500 to 1800. Full blood count and renal function remain normal.

Examination shows mild right upper quadrant tenderness but no other significant findings. Performance status remains 0.

MRI liver is scheduled for 4 weeks' time to assess response. We will review him in clinic with the imaging results to consider timing of second TACE procedure. He understands to contact us if he develops fever, severe pain, or other concerning symptoms in the meantime.
